column11:
This table provides the Fall 2020 summary of Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, showing how much instructional activity each school generated. Compared to earlier years, the data highlights some shifts, including the introduction of Health & Rehabilitation Sciences as a separate reporting unit.

By School (Fall 2020):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences: Largest unit with 54,598 credit hours, translating to about 3,485 FTE students.

Business: Accounted for 16,081 credit hours and 946 FTEs.

Education: Smaller in size, generating 5,385 credit hours, or 144 FTEs.

Health & Rehabilitation Sciences: Newer category, producing 10,646 credit hours for 537 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology: Significant load with 37,138 credit hours, supporting 2,288 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – credits taught at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – adjustment that gives extra weight to graduate teaching.

Grand Total Credit Hours – sum including extra credit.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized full-time equivalents (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
